24/12/18, 5:40 pm - Jagyaseni: <Media omitted>
24/12/18, 5:40 pm - Jagyaseni: *BEST PART ABOUT THE WORKSHOP*:
1. Mentors are under the age of 25 who are young achievers and has achieved a lot in their field of passion. 
2. Online platform for all the discussions, lessons and tasks. 
3. One month long workshop (Usually the workshops are only for two days)
4. Life long access to the workshop even after the completion of the workshop. ( So one year down the line, if you forgot something or want to revisit the content of the workshop, you can always access it.)
5. You will receive complete contact details of the mentors( so anytime during the workshop, you don't understand any content, you can always contact them. For instance, if you have taken the entrepurniship workshop, and you want to start your own startup but need someone to guide you or inform you if the idea is right or wrong, you can always approach the mentors and they might even invest in you if the idea is good)
6. Real time experience simulating tasks (for instance, if you take up writing workshop, your first assignment will probably be make a story or poem with the word 'angry' and it is not assignment such as where you have write the definition of writing and submit it. Hence, you understand the practical applications of each lessons and you can connect to them)
7. Only 1:20 ratio, one mentor and only 20 students per batch.
8. Live projects after the workshops will be given to you. 
9. After the completion of the workshop, you will receive a certificate which is endorsed by the United Nations and IIM Bangalore.

03/06/19, 1:30 am - Jagyaseni: * A 29 km long road consisting of 8 lanes is under construction along the Mumbai coast. The swampy forests in that area are being systematically destroyed for this purpose.
* Every year 1.15 million of plastic waste is carried into the Ganga.
* Every year air pollution causes 20,000 deaths worldwide. By 2030 it would be practically impossible to live without Oxygen kits ( Oxygen cylinder bags ).
* Climate change could be irreversible by 2030. 
* Climate change is creating a refugee crisis as millions are fleeing their homes to avoid the impacts of droughts and extremes of storms. People in the coastal areas are severely affected.

Memories and effects of the natural (man-made) disasters in Uttarakhand,Kerala,Nepal and Odisha are still fresh and living. 

* By 2030 Indians will have to buy 40% of their daily water requirement.

Scientists have presented numerous data regarding climate change all over the world. Information is bombarded into our brains leaving us helpless and insecured to the core. Some of us who feel threatened enough are looking around for help and ending up with NGO's which are no better than the state-corporate nexus and talk about reforms instead of radical changes in policies. Children from all over the world are striking for climate change. So,let's take this into our own hands and realise that we are a part of the environment that is so desperately damaged right now. Let us incorporate this resistance of the state machinery into our very lifestyles and search for a way. There is no way we are letting a handful of people trade our breaths. 

On 5th June,the World Environment Day we have decided to sell a booklet ( worth ten rupees ) on nature and environmental crisis near the 8B bus stand from 4 PM. We would also try to engage in a dialogue with the common people in order to further clarify our understanding regarding the rapid natural degradation. 
Keeping in mind the deterioration of climate and the urgency of the situation we hope that you would join us too.

13/06/19, 4:56 am - Raktim Dey: Etokhon Kafka on the Shore porchhilam. Boi ta oshadharon, gaye knata diye uthche. Raate brishti hochchilo, weather ta ektu better. Bhor poune pachtay baranday giye daralam, etai bodhoy the coldest part of the day, eto thanda hawa. Monei hobe na eta June mash. Er modhyei alo phutechhe baire accompanied with pakhider dak. This moment, it feels very pure. Kono duschinta mathay thake na, it all vanishes away. Rastay lok nei, shobai ghumachche, but you don't feel lonely. It's a strange feeling.

Ami impulsive ar unpredictable hoye gechhi hothat.

The Situation: More than one-third of the Hyderabadâ€™s population lives in slums 1179 slums have been identified by by GHMC officially. Slums continue to grow at a rate of 6.06% per annum. Primary sources of livelihood includes housekeeping, autorickshaws, blue collared work and street vending. The Children: Congested habitations and living conditions make academic excellence a challenge. Education is discontinued at a young age for most children due to financial constraints and safety concerns These kids are involved in household chores, child labor, child marriages What we do: Holistic development of lesser-privileged children.Courses are offered in: Academics, Self-defense, Vocational Training and Personality DevelopmentSpecial focus is laid on: Health and hygiene, Nutrition awareness, career counseling and extra curriculum activities. The Process: TKF volunteers visit recognized slum areas, and identify student groups from Govt. schools.Mentors are identified from the same slum, and employed...

15/09/20, 9:57 pm - Raktim Dey: <Media omitted>
15/09/20, 9:58 pm - Raktim Dey: Area of the rectangle plus area of the irregular parts.
15/09/20, 10:00 pm - Raktim Dey: For the upper irregular part, take AB as your x axis. Consider the irregular part as a curve. Take a partition of [A,B] and find the area under the curve over the limit A to B.
15/09/20, 10:00 pm - Raktim Dey: Similar for the left and right ones.
15/09/20, 10:02 pm - Jagyaseni: Partition of AB bolteh?
15/09/20, 10:02 pm - Jagyaseni: Baba re babaaaaağŸ§ğŸ§ğŸ§ğŸ§
15/09/20, 10:08 pm - Raktim Dey: If you take AB as your x axis, take A=0. If length of AB is 80, take B = 80. Partition of the interval [0,80].
15/09/20, 10:09 pm - Raktim Dey: Ei integration tai ektu complicated, because you don't know the function of the curve.
15/09/20, 10:09 pm - Jagyaseni: Exactly. How to know that?

27/09/21, 11:25 pm - Raktim Dey: In any case, I don't feel too good. I think I might be having anxiety attacks for a while. Ei bochhor amader ghore prothombar jol dhuklo, I mean amar room e. Twice this year, for the first time in seventeen years. And as a result, jokhon e brishti hoy,ba brishti hobe shuni, I start to panic. Weird, unrealistic visions come into my head. I feel like I'm drowning, as if jol er level ta amar mathar opore uthe jabe. All I did this evening was watch a TV series along with playing two songs at the same time, three of them together on a big headphone to drain out my thoughts. I feel like I'm afraid of the sound of rain now. I'm feeling tense and anxious all the time. I am telling you this because I don't think I could say this out to loud to anyone else right now. Maybe it's not the best idea, because you're going through a lot of things too, but I feel like I'm going to blow up if I didn't.

15/11/21, 1:40 am - Raktim Dey: There are two parts of my personality. One is inherited from my father's side of the family, the other from my mother. The father's side er personality is dominant. But in all honesty, I'd prefer my mother's side er genes to be dominant. The one that's loving, trusting, good natured, brave , understanding and basically nice. Maybe this is why it feels like I'm constantly arguing with myself. The two sides keep fighting to see who can be more dominant.
